basics.name: Andrew Panfilov
basics.label: Engineering Lead, Software Architect
basics.summary: Software Engineer with 16+ years of experience in software development. Main areas of expertise are micro-fulfillment, ad-tech, big data analysis, batch processing, high load systems.

skills.name: Analysis
keywords: Reviewing and auditing existed software architecture

skills.name: Design
keywords: Ability to design solid software architecture
Writing High- and Low-level design documents
Presenting designed solution to the stakeholders

skills.name: Development
keywords: Ability to hire, inspire, mentor, and encourage colleagues
Building prototypes of the software and tests them
Creating back-end and front-end parts of a software

work.summary: Takeoff Technologies is helping grocers thrive in eCommerce.
highlights: About my current role: I'm an engineering leader and architect for several teams that work on assortment, replenishment, retailer integration, warehouse inbound processes. I compose company-wide non-functional requirements, components coding guidelines, documentation explaining in graphical form business entity flows and deployment artifacts; facilitate technical roadmaps creation with ROI-based activities prioritization. I participate in severity-1 issues handling on production environments as an incident manager.

Responsibilities: people management; composing high and low-level design of the software; PoC creating; code review; technical documentation writing; hiring new engineers; leading group of engineers; coaching and experience transferring; requirement analysis.
Technologies and tools: Clojure, Apache Camel, Postgres, Docker, Kubernetes, JSON, EDN, Mac OS X, Git, Github, JIRA.

work.summary: Takeoff Technologies is helping grocers thrive in eCommerce.
highlights: Achievements: I was a technical leader and architect for the team that worked on the MFCaaS-retailers integration layer. We integrated with third-parties: retailers systems, e-commerce platforms, suppliers systems. During that time, my group had designed and implemented REST API for the third-parties integration, ETL component for processing information in files from the third-parties, orchestrator component for business processes automation, adapter component for the legacy ERP/WMS integration through SOAP protocol.

Responsibilities: people management; composing high and low-level design of the software; programming; PoC creating; code review; technical documentation writing; hiring new engineers; leading group of engineers; coaching and experience transferring; requirement analysis, tasks breakdown and estimating.
Technologies and tools: Clojure, Apache Camel, Postgres, Docker, Kubernetes, JSON, EDN, Mac OS X, Git, Github, JIRA.

work.summary: Takeoff Technologies is helping grocers thrive in eCommerce.
highlights: Achievements: a crucial part of MFCaaS – integration with robotic shelf through proprietary protocol and legacy ERP/WMS system was designed and implemented; an important part of the e-commerce system – service contracts component was designed and implemented; these components became the most stable and robust parts of the system.

Responsibilities: programming; PoC creating; code review; technical documentation writing; hiring new engineers; coaching and experience transferring; requirement analysis, tasks breakdown and estimating.
Technologies and tools: Clojure, ClojureScript, ArangoDB, CouchDB, Redis, OracleDB, Docker, JSON, EDN, Mac OS X, Git, Github, JIRA.

work.summary: Deal Flow Power Tool for VC & PE.

work.summary: Custom DWH and ETL for an advertising platform.
highlights: Responsibilities: designing DWH/ETL architecture; data flow designing; leading small team of Java developers; programming; PoC creating; testing and proving data processing ideas; defining data processing stack; composing technical documentation; code review; integration and unit test writing; coaching and transferring experience to back-end developers team; requirement analysis, tasks break down and estimating.

Technologies and tools: Java 8, Spring Framework (Core, Boot, MVC, Data JPA), Hibernate, Flywaydb, WSO2, Clojure, Cascalog, MySQL, Druid, Hadoop, Amazon EMR, Docker, Docker Machine, Docker Compose, Apache Tomcat, JSON, SQL, Jackson, Ubuntu, Mac OS X, JUnit, Mockito, Git, Jira, Jenkins.

highlights: Responsibilities: back-end development; code review; project architecture due diligence; proposing architectural approaches and technologies stack for synchronizing user data among iOS apps, Android apps and back-end.; composing technical documentation; integration and unit test writing; requirement analysis, tasks break down and  estimating.
Technologies and tools: Apache Tomcat, Spring Core, Spring MVC, Spring Data, JPA, Hibernate, PostgreSQL, H2, Stormpath, Java, JSON, Jackson, Ubuntu, Mac OS X, JUnit, Mockito, Git, Jira, Jenkins.

work.summary: Advertising platform. The platform allows companies to use mobile and traditional media to reach targeted consumers, engage the consumer through the mobile Internet and applications, convert them into customers and continue to actively manage the relationship through the mobile channel.
highlights: Responsibilities: requirement analysis and estimation; detail Design document writing; developing services in Java, Clojure, and Groovy.

Technologies and tools: Apache Tomcat, Leiningen, Spring Core, Spring, Batch, Spring Data, MyBatis, JPA, Hadoop, Cascading Impala, MySQL, PostgreSQL, H2,  Solr, Elasticsearch, RabbitMQ, Java, JSON, XML, XSD, WADL, JUnit, Mockito Git, Jira, Sonar, TeamCity, Jenkins.

work.summary: Poker, refactoring of legacy Poker game solution. Rewriting parts of existed poker servers.
highlights: Responsibilities: requirement analysis and estimation; detail Design document writing; developing an application in Java; refactoring legacy code; collaborating with a 2-4-member software team; collaborating with a core team; continuous Integration adjustment; build process creating and adjustment.
Technologies and tools: Playtech Poker Servers, Google Protobuf, Java, Groovy, XML, JSON, Black Box Testing, JUnit.  Jenkins CI, Apache Maven, Apache Ant, Sonar, Nexus, SVN, Jira, Icescrum.

work.summary: Video chat in the browser, Chatroulette clone based on RTMP server Red5 and Flash. Website implemented on Grails. The scalable solution consists of two web applications, deployed as war files. The first application contains embedded RTMP server Red5 with video streaming transcoding based on ffmpeg wrapper Xuggle Xuggler. The second application contains front-end implemented on Grails with zombie cookie technology Evercookie, Twitter Bootstrap and JQuery. The connection between applications implemented with Apache Camel, JMS and Apache ActiveMQ.
highlights: Responsibilities: requirement analysis and estimation; developing all parts of the solution with Java, Groovy, JavaScript, Openlaszlo; architecture designing.

Technologies and tools: Red5, Apache Tomcat, PostgreSQL, Grails, Spring Framework, JMS, Apache Camel, Apache ActiveMQ, Openlaszlo, Xuggle Xuggler, ffmpeg, Twitter Bootstrap, Java, Groovy, JavaScript, XML, Flash.

work.summary: Web service for media storage. Web service proxy for large media storage based on WSO2 Carbon platform.Supports SOAP (described as WSDL 1.1) and REST (described as WSDL 2.0). Intended for integration with partners in a large amount of television software.
highlights: Responsibilities: requirement analysis and estimation; High- and Low- Level Design document writing; developing an application in Java; collaborating with a 4 member software team; collaborating with a customer team; continuous Integration adjustment; build process creating and adjustment.

Technologies and tools: WSO2 Carbon, OSGi, Apache Axis2, Spring Framework, soapUI, REST, SOAP Java, Groovy, WSDL, XML, XSD, WADL.  Windows, Ubuntu.  Jenkins CI, Apache Maven, Sonar, Nexus, MKS, SVN, Trac.
